intro: Finckea eriocephala, commonly known as the silky finckea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its growth habit is typically low and mat-forming, with stems that often root at the nodes. Finckea eriocephala is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is valued for its ornamental appeal in dryland gardens.
